decision_conditions: The Oak tree can be viewed from the main road looking between properties. Along with other nearby trees it helps to provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings Broadwood Avenue/ Park Avenue and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The Oak has a moderate to high amenity value and significantly contributes to the arboricultural character of the local area.

The Oak does overhang into the neighbour's garden however as it is set away from the buildings this overhang is not seen as a reason for reduction. Pruning by as much as 3m would unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds into its crown, which would likely cause stress and lead to infection, affecting the Oaks long-term health; this would affect the safe useful life expectancy of the tree. Pruning would also result in weakly attached re-growth forming that would be prone to future failure.
Having regard to the reasons given for the proposed work, the work is unjustified and will have a detri
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 3m to One Oak T6 on TPO 459
